title: Which is correct, 'both of us' or 'each of us'? - Quora

response.answer_text: Jakeer, you certainly busy, Both are correct. But there is something that perhaps you don’t know about the two examples. Pay attention: “Both of us are going.” RULE: “The subject and its verb must agree.” “Both (subject) are (verb) going.” Pay attention: “Each of us IS going. RULE: “The subject of a sentence will NEVER BE IN A PREPOSITIONAL PHRASE!” So…”of us” is a prepositional phrase, therefore, “us” can’t be the subject, “each” is the subject and “each” is always singular. Pay attention: “Each of my 50 students IS nice.” “Each of my 37 aunts IS coming to visit.” “Each of the windows IS broken. They are, We are, cats are, horses are, clouds are, mountains are, each IS
